title: Lenovo Phab 2 (Champagne Gold, 32 GB)  (3 GB RAM)

product_specification.In The Box: Quick Start Guide, Earphone, SIM Tray Pin, Warranty Card, USB Cable, Handset, Travel Adapter
product_specification.Operating Frequency: GSM - Bands (2, 3, 5, 8); WCDMA - Bands (1, 2, 5, 8); 4G LTE (TDD) - Bands (38, 40, 41), LTE (FDD) - Bands (1, 3, 5, 7, 8, 20)
product_specification.Sensors: G-sensor, P-Sensor, L-sensor, E-compass, Gyroscope, Hall Sensor
product_specification.Warranty Summary: Brand Warranty of 1 Year Available for Mobile and 6 Months for Accessories

product_description.Display: Traffic can be a pain. We spend almost half of our day commuting to and from work. Why not make the time we're stuck in traffic enjoyable by watching movies, YouTube videos or playing games on the 16.25 cm HD screen of this phablet? The vibrant IPS display will help you experience the onscreen action from almost any angle.
product_description.Play it Out Loud and Clear: This smartphone helps you enjoy all your media content and games in cinematic audio quality, all thanks to Dolby Atmos technology. Whether you are watching movies or playing games, surround sound will always put you at the heart of the onscreen action.
product_description.Dolby Audio Capture 5.1: The three inbuilt microphones work together with Dolby Audio Capture 5.1 technology to record detailed and nuanced sound for your homemade videos. In addition to that, the 360-degree noise cancellation feature, conference-call and interview modes allow you to tailor your audio recordings for optimum clarity.
product_description.Say Cheese!: Going on a road trip and don't want to carry your bulky DSLR camera? Don't worry, you can leave the heavy camera behind and still be able to shoot videos and capture awesome photos, all thanks to the excellent cameras of this smartphone. The 13 MP rear camera features fast focus and an f/2.0 aperture to help you capture breathtaking photos, even in low light. The 5 MP front camera, with 85-degree wide angle lens, will let you fit all your friends in the frame while taking groupfies. Also, you can enhance your photos with the Augmented Reality effects before uploading to share them on Facebook and Instagram.
product_description.Powerful Performance: Underneath the sleek exterior of Lenovo Phab 2 lies a beast. The 1.3 GHz MediaTek (MTK 8735) quad-core processor, along with 3 GB RAM, offers more scope for multitasking. You can browse the Internet for recipes, chat with your friends, upload and share photos, and switch between applications smoothly and quickly.
product_description.Storage: Featuring 32 GB of internal memory, this phablet offers enough space for all of your movies, photos and apps. Thanks to the microSD slot, you can add up to 128 GB of external memory to further expand your storage space.
product_description.Long-lasting Battery: The 4050 mAh Li-ion battery of this smartphone gives you long-lasting performance between charges. Call your mom, play games, stream videos, listen to music, shoot photos - do whatever you love to do, the battery won't call it a day until you do.

review:
Sometimes, size does matter. Lenovo’s new goliath. the Phab 2, is a smartphone with a screen that can put most of its category counterparts to shame. Besides the large screen, you also get a metal build and a host of other awesome features.

Taking a closer look at the device, the first thing that you will notice is the large display. The Lenovo Phab 2 sports a colossal 6.4-inch HD display. The large size is great for those who love watching a lot of videos, or playing graphic-heavy games.

Just above the display is the earpiece, front camera and sensors. The phone sports a 5MP front-facing camera. So for all you selfie lovers, the Lenovo Phab 2 can deliver.

At the bottom of the phone you’ll find the speakers and a standard micro USB port. The Lenovo Phab 2 comes with Dolby Atmos audio enhancements. This combined with the large display, make the phone perfect for watching videos.

At the back of the phone is the 13MP primary camera. Like the phone’s elder brother, the Phab 2 Plus, you get an AR mode. With this turned on, you will be able to add a cat, puppy, fairy, or even a dragon to any picture. That’s not all, you can also interact with the virtual creatures and play with them.


What’s the point of having a large display if you can’t spend hours watching videos on it. The Lenovo Phab 2 comes with a 4050mAh battery, which should be enough to last you all through the day.

4) Phone on charging ..A cal comes in..remove the phone from charge mouth piece does not work - Reboot the mobile.


Please request you all to keep away from this phone, Good for nothing it is.

I am an avid MI user and practically I feel no phone can match to the hardware and software tuning that an MI device gives. bee using a MI note, note 3, note 4 and also possess an MI Max9the big daddy).

this is an honest review after 3 weeks of intense usage.
I will go straight to the specs.
Dont think anything about the processing power, its mindblowing .A massive 3 GB RAM, MediaTek (MTK 8735) quad-core processor, the Lenovo Phab 2 takes your smartphone experience to the next level for sure.
Although my redmi note 3 still uses 3gb ram what I have found is the ram left after using the same number of apps on both, the phab 2 still has approx 1.72gb of ram free whereas the Redmi note 3 has only 1.2 to 1.5gb free which is a remarkable spec considering the display size is massively huge in Lenovo Phab 2.
Theres no lag in the apps and the the smartphone works butter smooth.theres no heating issue at all even with the phone being on charge for a long time. The redmi note 3 has ample amount of heating issue. The ram the storage is more than enough and u can slide a massive 128gb micro sd card to expand beyond the normal level.
Now comes the most important part the display.

Guys remember this is a sub 10k range phone so dont expect this to have a brilliant display like samsung or infinity display type stuff. Saying that I just loved this display at 65-70% brightness and a great Airtel 4g connection, HD videos on youtube are a treat to watch. the display is crisp, colors ae good and the screen melts into the bezel so effeortlessly that you wont need a tv or a larger monitor once u a re habituated with this device. Chats and scrolling fb , twitter are so easy with the big display. Also needs to be mentioned is the touch responsiveness which is simply awesome, the touch reponse is so good u can actually somehow use the device with one hand although its big for one hand usage.
I guess the back side is removable which is a great thing considering the massive battery and the heat dissipitation once can expect from a device.
Only one small issue I felt was the lack of enough battery for a heavy usage user like me for the entire day but who cares till you have a MI or ROMOSS power bank with you. the battery lasts for one complete day with oderate to heavy usage and remember by usage i am meaning Airtel 4g usage. streaming, whatsapp, fb continously with almost 2hrs of talktime daily and 2 hrs of music almost thats a great battery but if it would have been 5000mah it was awesome. 4050mah is descent and does justice.
theres no fingerprint scanner but doenst matter much as this is a budget phablet.
The smartphone is 4g enabled and it always receive 4g for sure. the secondary sim is a 2g one.

theres no call block facility in lenovo so I have installed the Zen Asus UI dialer for the same, now its a complete mean machine.

Laslty the Dolby ATMOS my goodness the sound effect surpasses the reproduction quality of my 5000rs pioneer car stereo impact. Audio quality is a tricky stuff as i am weariing a spec so cannot put the phone so big on the ears but with earphones the audio s awesome voice call clarity is simply superb.

It has been a month since I have been using this device and here are my takes on the Lenovo Phab 2.

Pros:

1. Sturdy built quality. Feels pretty premium in the hands contemplated by a sleek design.

2. Screen size is precise and appropriate and justifies its name of a phablet. It can be user with one hand, while it is big enough for sufficing your media cravings.

3. Device is pretty fast (considering the legacy of tabs). Lenovos decision to eliminate graphic transitions in return for a better performance is commendable here.

4. Camera quality is decent. Daytime pictures are OK types; however low performance is not up to the mark.

5. Display is crisp enough. Viewing angles are decent for the price range.

6. The presence of a notification LED is appreciable from my side.

Having said that, lets have a look at its downsides.

Cons:

1. Battery - Perhaps its biggest disadvantage here. In spite of sporting a 4050 mAh battery, it drains out within 18 hours ( with average usage). Additionally, battery drains considerably fast even when kept idle.

This may be the case only with my device; however I would like some insights from others here as well.

2. Lenovo promises DOLBY AUDIO here. However both headphone and speaker sounds are not up to the mark.

Mark my words; the sound is not bad at all. In fact its pretty impressive. However considering my experiences with Moto in the past and an Apple now, the Lenovo seems to be lagging behind a bit.

However, all things mentioned, the price point must also be taken into consideration.

Other than this, the device performs pertty well and is a perfect choice for individuals looking for a budget large screen device for their daily online tasks. Overall a GOOD BUY.

I purchased this phone in the month of May 2017. After a few months of use my views:

Pros:
1) It gives a rich look
2) The sound quality does not have bass but it is loud. You don't need additional speakers for listening in a room.
3) The rear camera quality is super. The macro photography is simply awesome.
4) The front camera comes with a feature of selfie and group selfie. The front camera quality is good.
5) Viewing photos and videos is a good experience on this phone. You don't need a tab to view it.
6) It comes with a 5000 MAH battery which is long lasting. But if you are viewing videos continuously, the battery gets discharged quickly as it is a big screen phone.
7) Call quality is loud and clear including Reliance Jio calls.

Cons:
1) The phone does not have fast charging. It takes about 6 hours to get full charged. You have to keep it overnight.
2) Front camera does not have flash.
3) There is no dedicated memory card slot. You can use it either as dual SIM or with one SIM and a memory card.
4) The phone is a bit heavy. It does not fit in pocket properly. For women, it will not fit in their palms.

You may go for it with the advantages of this phone.

I would like to inform you that I bought a Lenovo Phab2 Phone via online mode from Flipkart on 21st Jan 2018, and I received it on 29th Jan. I did start using it from 6th Feb 2018.



When I started using this phone, It was okay, But after one month. The charging function was not working properly, it revealed that phone had connected with charger as usual. But, actually it was not connected with charger and battery was going to about to die.



When I disconnected the charger from phone, it always showed that phone was getting charge.



I don’t know why its happing with my phone. After all I had visited nearby my place service center of Lenovo care. It is “Net Dot Solution in Tilak Nagar, Delhi-110018” on 10th Mar 2018 at 10AM,

Here I had discussed with Preet Singh. Who was associated over there for Lenovo tablet care department at that time. I described all the details to Preet Singh and he told me that right now I could not help you. Because sir “Lenovo software was not working properly. So, he suggested to me, that I had to visit to another service center for the service. After that I came to my place with upset mind.



But, somehow I did switch off the phone and on it. then I found that unfortunately my phone was working .



There after I did use it another 20 days. And now I am facing the same problem. And yesterday 5th Apr ’18, I have already visited the same Service center and I got the news that “Net Dot Solution in Tilak Nagar, Delhi-110018”. Has been closed for tablet service care. Indeed it’s a bad sign for the customers.



Now, here I am seeking the service at “Net Dot Solution in Tilak Nagar, Delhi-110018” for My tablet. Or else change my phone.



Please take a look seriously and let me know you input.

One of the best phone, tablet in market.

Pro:
Most frugal 32 GB Android tablet in market that provides 4G connectivity with VOLTE.

Good front and back camera, generally specs. Keeps promise

Con:
1)Android 6 problem. Shortcuts, saved accounts in apps moved to 128 GB micro SD card (Samsung, bought from Flipkart) are erased on reboot. One would have to re enter password for each Twitter, Facebook accounts or go through play store to access installed apps. Some offline games moved to SD card can't be accessed (Installed Google Now launcher to access them when offline)

2) No fast focus

3) No dedicated micro SD card. Have use another mobile for multiple SIM

4) Heating when high number of apps (around 500 including factory apps) are installed

Worked fine initially for 3-5 months. Left speaker didn't work since the day 1. I thought it must be some Equalizer problem but it was something else.

Phone mic stops working sometimes which is very irritating when you neend to make an important call.

Once your phone memory is 75% full, phone will lag like anything. It will literally take 30-40 seconds to open an application.

Camera is poor and it wasn't unexpected either.

Battery drains like anything. Full charge will last for 6-7 with 4G VOLTE Network.

The best part is large screen for which I actually opted this phone.

An awesome product by Lenovo!!

I am really impressed by the quality of phones that lenovo has released in last few years (of course being patent holder of Motorola!!). I first bought vibe k5 series and the phone is working nicely.

With the offer from Flipkart, I bought Phab2 provided the features we would never at this price. I would like to pinpoint the following basic features of the phone:

1. Batteries: Lenovo claims the batter would work for one day and it does. I run 3g all the day (being a trader!) and then too battery discharge is only 45% by 4:30 pm.

2. Screen size: Big screen is so good for a phone

3. Dolby speakers: You will never find such a fine quality dolby sound in a phone. it is a great experience to watch movie, listen radio, etc on the phone.

4. Noise cancelling earphones: They provide this with the phone and phew! they are amazing earphones

5. Fast battery charger: My 4100mAmp battery gets charged within an hour from 20% to 100%.
6. Touch, RAM and Internal memory works finely with some additional settings and features.

Cons for some will be the size and weight of the phone. But trust me, the kind of phone it is, a little pain of carrying it is worth it!

For me 10,999 is a huge amount. Yesterday)30th Jan 2017) I bought it and its been 1 day(31st Jan 2017) today since I've been using it. Please also note that I have been using xiaomi for last two year and I was/am pretty happy with xiaomi and its features.
Even after reading some bad reviews and complaints, I thought to buy this phone (as xiaomi 6.4 inch mi max phone is not available yet - out of stock).
My main purpose is to surf whatsapp, facebook, youtube etc so I'm not bother about camera, ram and rom but they are good.

After using this phone for one day only, I can say that this phone is good so far. Its not preloaded with so many apps, that's fine for me. 6.4 inch screen looks good that's why I bought it but I felt weight is more so for day to day use, it becomes a bit uncomfortable but again I'm okay with it. You can't handle it with one hand due to big screen. For camera whatever it is, I'm fine with it.

Overall, for this price and these features, phone is good not saying so good because
1) it doesn't have gorilla glass protection so be ready to spend more money on getting tempered glass
2) As I belong to Xiaomi users, I found so many features are missing but that's a completely different story as Xiaomi is famous for its features with less price. I'd still say I like Xiaomi when it comes to its features.
3) Bottom menu buttons. Lenovo has changed them. For right-handed user its quite hard to press back button as back button position is changed. looking for any option so I can change functionality of menu buttons.
(menu buttons have back light that's good)

For only 3rd point I don't like this mobile but rest things are good and if you are planning to buy it, you can buy. I don't have any complain to make as of now.
I'd still prefer to go with Mi Max but now I can't but you guys can. It doesn't mean this phone is bad or something its just with Xiaomi, you'll have so many features.

One last thing - this mobile price is 11,999. Phab2 plus and Mi Max 14,999.
You exactly can't compare this mobile with Mi Max as you have Lenovo Phab 2 plus to compare with it. So for this price, this phone is good and no other phone is available to compare with it.

I bought this product very recently (it has not been a month yet). I got it in pristine condition and it works just great. Gaming, reading using apps all are good but since last couple of days it is showing some problems with the battery and the mic. The problem at first was that the phab immediately after showing 24% charge (within seconds, not minutes) it turned on battery saver and showed that the charge left was 15% and just after that it shut down. When I plugged it in, it showed me the battery was empty and within 2-3 minutes it showed 13% charge is done. This happened thrice in last two days. And the other problem is that sometimes when taking a call I can hear the caller but the person on the other end seems to be not receiving any audio from my end. The problem with the mic is solved by rebooting but this one occurs more often than the other one. By the way before anything else I must say that all the apps running are from google play store only and most of them are supported by google. This phone is really good in terms of working, reading, browsing and even gaming. If these issue had not come up I would not have written this review instead just would have given the product 4 stars this much good of a product this is in terms of performance.
After using it for 3 months without getting it to the service centre it's working pretty good and all the problems have been sorted out automatically and damn this phab is making my life hell lot of easier. It's worth every penny. Go and get it.

Lenovo Phab 2 The phone comes with a 6.40-inch touchscreen display with a resolution of 720 pixels by 1280 pixels. Lenovo Phab 2 price in India starts from Rs. 10,999.

The Lenovo Phab 2 is powered by quad-core MediaTek MTK8735 processor and it comes with 3GB of RAM. The phone packs 32GB of internal storage that can be expanded up to 128GB via a microSD card. As far as the cameras are concerned, the Lenovo Phab 2 packs a 13-megapixel primary camera on the rear and a 5-megapixel front shooter for selfies.

The Lenovo Phab 2 runs Android 6.0.1 and is powered by a 4050mAh non removable battery. It measures 175.00 x 89.50 x 5.50 (height x width x thickness) and weigh 225.00 grams.

The Lenovo Phab 2 is a single SIM (GSM) smartphone that accepts a Nano-SIM. Connectivity options include Wi-Fi, GPS, Bluetooth, NFC, 3G and 4G. Sensors on the phone include Compass Magnetometer, Proximity sensor, Accelerometer, Ambient light sensor and Gyroscope.

This rating is just for the poor service from Flipkart and not the product. Order and delivery experience was fine, the older phone was handed over in exchange and got the new phone. The real problem started with the faulty device I got.
After I found issue with SIM slot, which was not working after trying all kind of options, raised the request for replacement. Got a call from call center to verify my request, after I told about the problem and the steps I had tried to resolve, I was asked all kind of stupid questions on whether I inserted the SIM in proper way...if it was the correct SIM format... whether I really performed those troubleshooting steps and wanted me to explain those in detail.
Next thing, they wanted to send a technician home to verify my claims. The replacement request was accepted only after the technician confirmed the same problem. The whole process took 2 weeks.
Luckily, I had a backup phone at home...otherwise I would have been left without a phone for 2 weeks :-(. I think, we should start accepting the package only after we test the device during delivery.

1. The person at the other end of the call isn't able to hear me once I disconnect the earphone/headset. Reconnecting the headset isn't helping. Issue isn't sorted even after rebooting the phone. The other party is able to hear me on calls only after multiple reboots or a factory reset. The only other way to counter this problem is to use a VOIP service (WhatsApp/Skype) to make and answer calls. Then the headset doesn't seem to cause this issue. I have tested 14 headsets and earphones and faced this issue with each and every one of them.
2. When I try to share or upload a file from the Downloads folder or any other folder I get an error message that reads "screen overlay detected" and I'm prompted to turn this off in the settings subsection of the apps settings. However, when I visit the apps settings I see nothing that pertains to screen overlay. So I try to switch off the "Draw over other apps" setting for each app one by one which is a tedious and irritating process. But this doesn't sort the problem.
3. The phone offers 2 choices: format memory card as internal memory and use memory card as external memory without formatting. When used as external, the phone stores apps to internal. When the memory card is formatted as internal, the phone combines internal and external memory. But on restarting the phone the app icons are lost and I have to open them from the Play store. So I'm forced to use the memory card as external memory instead of formatting it as internal and thus getting increased space for app storage.

Verdict: the hardware of this phone seems to be just about ok but the software is riddled with glitches that the updates aren't taking care of. I never expected this from a brand like Lenovo and I feel like an utter fool.

Iam writing this review after using it for almost 1 month.
Pros
1. Display is awesome. No problem faced even in broad daylight.
2. Massive size. Feels expensive. No problem using in single hand.
3. Awesome video and sound quality.
4. Pretty fast processor in budget range. No hanging issue experienced till date.
5. Budget friendly. After discount and exchange, got this on 7890.

Cons
1. Major problem is the speaker quality. During a call, you can hear everything clear but the other person can't hear u properly. This problem persisted even after update.
2. Camera is ok. Front camera is bit disappointing.
3. Even if battery is 4050 mAh; if u use it continuously, it hardly lasts 24 hrs. With maximum use it can last upto 14-15 hrs.

Except the speaker; everything else is manageable. Overally a good Phablet in budget.

AS I was not satisfied with the mobile I have raised refund request, so in the first attempt, Flipkart had arranged the verification call on Sunday 16th at 8:00 PM but I didn't receive a call from them, Later on when I checked on Flipkart site they rescheduled the call for 18th at 2 PM.

However, at the same time I already had an another planned appointment, so on the 18th morning I called Flipkart customer care to reschedule, but they denied by commenting that some issue is going on in the system. As per schedule, I got a call at 2 PM sharp, but as I already in the meeting I requested to reschedule a call after half an hour, But eventually I didn't get any call back from Flipkart so I called them again and they refused to refund and keep on repeating that they do not have any refund policy for mobile phones.

So I requested a customer executive to transfer my call to the next level so he tried to connect me with the available senior guy, but no luck, even I waited for 5 minutes on the call, so I requested him to arrange a call back with senior but he denied and ask me to call because Flipkart does not have any call back process in such cases.
When I called Lenovo technical support I came to know that these are genuine issues with the product so Flipkart has to give the refund and they can send back all such products back to the company, It was already reported with Lenovo and they are working on it to resolve. In addition same has already been clarified by Flipkart technical person but they even not bother to that.

On contrary Flipkart is not ready to refund as they do not have a refund policy for mobile phones, so now I do not understand because of Flipkart internal policy issue I am getting suffered and ultimately if nothing will happen I will have to use the product with the limitations.

Through this long story I want to highlight that the reputed online shopping company Flipkart is not bothered at all about customer satisfaction after you purchased and they got the money, even they defined their processes and guidelines in such a way that the customer should not reach their senior members

I went for this phone for big screen and memory. Got it below 10K in Christmas Flipkart offers. So far I am happy with the phone. There are few software and hardware problem though.
First is I was not getting notification from hike messenger. Found that in settings - accessibility hike is off. Even though I turn it on, it gets off every time I clear the running instance of hike messenger from memory/close the app. As a workaround I kept hike messenger running in background by clicking the lock key which shows during checking currently running apps.
The phone's speaker is superbly placed at both side of the charging point. Hence it gives awesome sound even when I lay the phone back on a surface. Unfortunately out of the two speaker slots, one doesn't work, not sure it's a fault or internally there is no speaker behind the left slot, can't remove back panel/battery so cannot check. But the right speaker itself is capable enough to rock your party.
The battery is superb. Overall having a good experience so far, but sooner or later have to visit service centre to check out the speaker issue. Hopefully the software issues will be resolved by Lenovo through software upgrades.

pros.4050 mAh Battery: The 4050 mAh battery of this phablet gives long battery life and lasts for a day on normal use.
pros.16.26 cm (6.4 inch) IPS Display: This phablet comes with an IPS display which is very crisp and gives decent viewing angles at this price range.
pros.Build Quality: This phablet has a sturdy built quality and comes with a sleek and premium design.
pros.Sound: This phablet features Dolby atmos speakers which gives cinematic audio quality and is very impressive at this price.

cons.Camera: The 13MP primary camera and 5MP secondary camera are of average quality and does a bad job of capturing photos and videos.
cons.Charging: This phablet does not have fast charging because of which it takes almost 6 hours to fully charge.

summary.verdict: The Lenovo Phab 2 is a good affordable phablet which comes with some amazing and premium features. Perfect choice for phablet lovers!
summary.Additional Information: Supports OTG, Supports Volte, Calling Tablet, Fits into pocket.
